manage save commands after opening new doc

timeline.bodyText:
The active parameter actually represents whether or not this is this column is the current active column. (activeEditor_ is only populated for the active column) You'll see in manageSaveCommands we use getNextActiveEditor() instead of directly accessing the active editor, this is a function that will return the editor that would become active if the column became active.
When you open a new doc it gets set to the active editor so this code works fine except in the very unlikely case where this function gets called after the user has moved on and is working with a different file. Really it doesn't make a difference, but I think we should pass this == manager.getActive() here.
